title: Prestongold
author: Prestongold
content: I thought that this thread is the most appropriate at this time because it will serve as a warning for newbies and other rank members never to trust a scammer that said he has repented just like in the case of 1xbit, and other scam casinos or other cryptocurrencies projects that have promoted the services here in the forum before their final exit.1xbit is a notorious scam casino, that professionalizes in seizing players' huge deposits and winnings by blocking their¬†accounts outrightly.I can still remember when the 1xbits campaign came on board,¬† many of the participants were warned not to participate in this signature campaign or risk being red-tagged, while some of them desist from promoting the scam casinos others continued regardless and were red-tagged, now the party is over and they accounts are ruined for life.What this means to newbies is, never trust any project or company that has scam allegations against them no matter what their promise in return, in the long run, you will become their victim too just like 1xbit promoters.

comments.body: Quote from: Prestongold on May 17, 2023, 12:59:40 PMI thought that this thread is the most appropriate at this time because it will serve as a warning for newbies and other rank members never to trust a scammer that said he has repented just like in the case of 1xbit, and other scam casinos or other cryptocurrencies projects that have promoted the services here in the forum before their final exit.It's true that 1xbit has been one casino with a very bad reputation both on and off the forum with series of scam accusations for many years, and a red flag on the forum, which seems not to care about users complaint nor relent on it's forum activities (i.e signature campaign and other promotion) at the detriment of it's forum advertisers. But if I may ask where did you get the information that they finally left the bitcointalk forum? Because from the look of things they don't seems like a casino ready or willing to ever leave this forum today or anytime soon, as this is not the first time they closing a signature campaign, going off the forum for weeks and later coming back with a claim of repentance and willingness to pay back all scam funds.

comments.author: Maslate
comments.body: We are already aware of the reputation of this site, so it's up to us to evaluate whether we still trust them with our money. I'm sure they will run a signature campaign from time to time, so I don't believe that they have completely left the forum.The red tag given to the OP and the members of the campaign serves as a sufficient warning for newcomers to check their reputation, and the community has already done a lot to alert others. However, this site is large and widely present, even on popular social media platforms.
